title: Fearful
body: My partner was an inpatient last year on MAU. He was ignored by staff when he said his venflon was blocked and his hand was hurting. He was treated very unkindly by another member of staff and spoken to very rudely. He was in tears when I came to fetch him home. He said he never wanted to go to hospital again. Today he had to go into the Alex for an investigation. He has been worried and not sleeping since knowing. No matter how good most staff are, and some are wonderful,  there are a few that do not care and can make a hospital experience horrific for a patient. He needs surgery now and I am terrified because I will not be allowed to visit and he will be at the mercy of whoever is on duty. Much is said about staff not being prepared to put up with abuse but there are those who seem not to care about the patients and are dismissive, disrespectful and unkind. Staff are there for the patients not the other way round. A bad experience can stay with a patient for years. Please be kind. What if that person was your mother, partner, child. Patients are ill, in pain and frightened.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: McHardy
title: Concern regarding discharge home
body:
My main concern regarding discharge home was that I would not be able to access the over bath shower. The OT, from Home First was very professional, supportive & holistic approach as to what had been a very worrying time for my husband, family & me.  
The essential equipment was delivered promptly. I am now six weeks post -op. The ergonomics are perfect for ironing with the use of the perching stool. I am actually enjoying ironing as this makes me feel I am slowly returning to independent daily living. The TREAT-EEZI Seat pad in my armchair certainly relieves any low back pain so I can now sit & relax. As for independent personal care, the installation of the bath board means I can access the shower over the bath & what a good start to the day that is.

title: Constructive Criticism
body:
Firstly, I am shocked at how many negative reviews are on this platform and sad that I have to add to the total.
I had Laser Resurfacing for acne which was very expensive and so I had to save up for it. The actual procedure was carried out by an NHS Doctor and was better/less painful than I had anticipated. 
I am now into my 8th month post treatment and still have visible white and red areas on my skin. I have been told this will eventually go but only time will tell. I really hope so as I am currently having to wear heavy camouflage make up. My overall opinion of the clinic is as follows:-
It COULD be so much better! Many staff are untrained (ie not qualified nurses), young, inexperienced and unprofessional. They look the part but lack empathy and “people skills”. This could be improved by spending a little more time and money on training and recruitment. 
The actual clinic was cramped, uninviting, lacked privacy (especially with the reception area in the middle of the room where everyone can see and hear) and had no refreshment facilities.
The paperwork was well out of date, certain things were not explained (despite me asking) and offered things as part of the procedure which were “no longer available/applicable”! 
Another simple thing to rectify/update.
The Doctor lacked any bedside manner, warmth or empathy. I got the impression this was simply a money making exercise (to supplement his NHS salary perhaps)! There was a general lack of interest in me or the work being carried out. In fact, the Doctor almost seemed “world weary”! I thought perhaps it was just an “off day” but this has been the case at every visit! Again, this could be rectified .
The treatments are overpriced and there was a definite emphasis on selling products - at further expense!
I hope this is taken as constructive criticism. This clinic could be SO much better - and hopefully will be one day soon. 
Thank you.

title: Bad Practice
body:
Tried to make my mother an appointment with this practice, they only do phone call appointments so I asked what time so I can arrange to be present as my mother is very deaf.  They can't give a time just some time between 9:00-12:00 today.
they also asked what the problem is, why should you have to discuss you medical condition with a none medical person.
I hope the person looking at this review and all the other bad review's acts on them.

title: Saved my life
body: Prompt and skilful action saved my life and all due to the excellent doctors and staff at Millfield Surgery.

title: Excellent staff
body: I brought my 5 year old daughter today who is very nervous and shy. The nurses and pediatrician we saw were amazing with her. I really cant recommend them enough.

title: inappropriate instructions in appointment letter
body:
I attended the x-ray department (not listed here) for a routine annual repeat kidney ultrasound scan.  Although my bladder was not to be scanned the appointment letter instructed me to drink 1lt of water an hour before the scan.  The radiologist asked me to empty my bladder in order for him to carry out the scan, and told me that it had not been necessary for me to drink the water.  I did not wish to visit the toilet during this pandemic, but the incorrect instructions contained in my letter made this necessary.  How thoughtless and unprofessional of either the person preparing the letter or maybe of the clinician who arranged the appointment but did not give full details of whether water was necessary.  They unnecessarily made me quite uncomfortable and also wasted a lot of the radiologist's time, while he waited for me.  

Your survey questions are ambiguous and difficult to answer correctly.  Which staff do you refer to?  My experience of x-ray department staff was excellent.  Of the administrative staff it was not. My above comments relate to the administrative staff who prepared my invitation letter; that letter stated that I might be seen by a man or woman.  Is that what is meant by same sex?

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Wonderful hospital
body: I had to attend the minor injury unit recently due to an accident at work.. the staff was professional & friendly.. even in these testing times for them all.. put me at ease and treated promptly.. this hospital is a credit to the NHS..

title: I feel like I don't even have a doctor.
body:
I feel like I might as well not even be registered to a doctors surgery.

I've got a chest infection that I've had for months. I've got an ear infection that I've had for over a year. I've got a sinus infection. I work a job where I am exposed to Weils disease and yet to get a simple appointment is impossible. Any doctor that takes 1 look at me would prescribe me with anti biotics and send me on my way yet I can't even seem to see my doctor.

When I call there's never any appointments. There's no online booking system. It's just absolute cack. Then the fact that they're not open on weekends. This surgery is exactly like the NHS in 2020 as a whole. It literally can not cope with the demand due to the influx of people. People like me who work hard and have paid into the system suffer as a consequence.

title: Thank you for being there.
body: Just wanted to big up the NHS in general, great nurses and doctors  for being there when we need them most. You never now when you might need there services, some countries do not have the luxury of this great NHS service, so a big Thank you to all involved.

readBy.name: University Hospitals of Morecambe Bay NHS Foundation Trust

author: ZR
title: Poor patient centred care
body:
I write this with great disappointment in the care my newborn and I have received from this practice.  
The care I received did not appear to be patient centred or show concern for my newborn. My newborn was suffering from breathing difficulties, and I requested to speaker to a G.P.This was refused by the Receptionist, and advised to contact the Health Visitor.The Health Visitor advised to wait a further 4 days and this would be followed up on a routine planned visit.  
I expressed my concerns given my new born was suffering from breathing difficulties.  
I advised the HV I was becoming increasingly more anxious regarding the care of my newborn.  
The Health Visitor advised contact would be made to the Practice Manager.  
A Practice Manager contacted me, and advised a G.P could not help.  
Advised to go to A/E , however given this was in the hours of the practice being opened this appeared unreasonable given my concerns of taking a new born to hospital in the current COVID climate.  
At this point I was extremely anxious for the welfare of my newborn.  
I asked for their name as I was going to raise my concerns.  
They hung up the phone without any warning .  
I am extremely disappointed in the care of my newborn.  
My newborn still has breathing difficulties which have not been resolved.  
As mother I only wish for the best care for my child and I have clearly not received this.  
I would request the Health board review my concerns, so no other parent has to go through my poor experience.

author: Larghan
title: Mental health
body:
I was a very active person until lockdown. I coped well to begin with then came the announcement about mandatory face coverings in shops etc. I contacted my medical practice and got misinformation from the practice manager for which I registered a complaint. I got a response but too late to undo the damage done to my state of mind.  
I was coping with my face visor, I have a phobia of face coverings, until, the first Minister announced that face visors on their own were not enough. I was then politely asked to not come back to a local shop and everything has gone downhill since then.  
I am now scared to go out other than to walk my dog in open spaces. I have lost all confidence and spend a lot of time sobbing. At night I have dreadful nightmares which are repetitive so I get up rather than endure them. I am sole carer to my alcoholic much older husband who has dementia and refuses all help. I am at my wits end. Who do I turn to now?

author: Moon Aunty
title: My doctors practice
body:
During a weekend in lockdown. I wasn't too well and phoned 111. They gave me excellent advice and suggested I call my doctor on Monday.  
I must say that whilst my condition was easily managed. My care and the responses to my calls, for advice and for medication was speedy, targetted and excellent. I felt totally reassured and cared for.  
It made me realise just how lucky I am with my doctors. The reception staff, the medics all give their best and the service I receive is always superb. Everyone has been working so hard. Just wanted to say a heart felt thankyou to Yardley Green Mefical centre Birmingham.

author: Hospitalpatient5
title: An amazing experience
body:
I attended the day case unit for surgery in the wake of the COVID-19 situation. Prior to attending the hospital, I received two tests to ensure I was clear for COVID, I was also screened for a high temperature prior to being admitted onto the ward. I am a very nervous person, who has never had surgery before but I do have underlying health conditions. Due to this, I was slightly concerned that they may be exacerbated by the general anesthetic/also the stress of the surgery on my body.  
I can honestly say that it was an amazing experience. From arriving early and being welcomed by a lovely receptionist, who despite wearing a face mask still radiated pure kindness and immediately put me at ease with her lovely sense of humor. The nurses were so kind and caring, paying great attention to detail, and constantly checking how I was. This was pre and post-surgery, constantly making sure I wasn't in pain, and my other conditions were managed. My privacy and dignity were maintained throughout the procedure by the nurses and all members of staff, with heartwarming compassion towards not only me but the other patients on the ward.  
The two anaesthesiologists that helped choose the right sedation for me. The level to which they catered the drugs to my every need and ensured that anything I was concerned about was addressed, also giving me extra anti-nausea drugs which meant when I woke up I felt amazing and was in disbelief that I had even had surgery. My consultant and the students supporting her were also amazing and really kind, explaining things to me and ensuring I felt ok constantly, despite being extremely busy. Also, the male nurse who was in recovery bay 2 and the male porter who moved me back into the other bay were true gentlemen and the best way to wake up from surgery with their funny jokes and cheerful nature.  
Overall, I am blown away by the kindness of the staff on the ward and want to assure anyone who is going in for day case surgery that you are in the best hands possible, the staff will go the extra mile and help you with anything you required. Some of the sweetest and kindest people I've ever met, true heroes of the NHS and lovely people. Can't thank you all enough

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Very Poor reception
body:
Visited the surgery at the end of covid to collect bloods sheet. There was a long queue of people waiting outside. People knocked on the door, but no response at all. The receptionists were sitting behind two sets of doors, looking like they were hiding from view.
The pharmacy next door then told us to ring the bell instead - there's NO sign saying "please wait but we are in" on the front door pointing the bell out - it's one of those grey switch looking things - looks more like a light switch. So people ring the bell, no response whatsoever from inside. Ring again, no response. Keep on ringing - someone picks it up, puts the receiver down and doesn't speak at all. Then it goes dead again. We keep on ringing, the receptionist answers, then puts it down halfway through the conversation. Then they don't pick it up again. To say the experience was painful doesn't quite do it justice. Maybe reception thinks they are doing us a disservice by answering at all. You need a new office manager, or an office manager.
PS The official website states that CQC Rating is Good, but it isn't. It "requires improvement", please change the website because it appears disingenuous.

title: Complete lack of care
body: Nothing to do with coronavirus. Every time I see a doctor at this surgery, getting a referral seems like they are doing me a favour. It happened several times that after seeing the test results, the doctor just communicated them to me, with no intention to take further action. I have to tell the doctor what to do next. I almost have to beg for a referral. They also tend to ignore the consultant's recommendation and refer me to a random clinic, not to the one indicated by the consultant. I hope I can switch to a better surgery asap. Because this one has doctors that don't care at all about their practice and patients.

title: Reception experience
body: I am generally satisfied by my treatment from the practice but work does need to be done with certain members of reception staff on how not to inflame a potentially flammatory situation. When you have tried to get through on the phone for 30 minutes (without success) and then queued patiently for 20 minutes at the surgery because your call wasn't answered, you do not want to be met with no eye contact when you try to speak or being  stonewalled when you again try to talk. The receptionist I spoke to appeared to be new and actually dealt with things really well and apologised for my wait. She was courteous and personable. The receptionist she called to assist her was surly. My husband had missed a call because he not remove his PPE quickly enough whilst at work. He had tried to call back immediately, with no success. I tried for him and ended up visiting the surgery because my call wasn't answered. Comments like "I can't ask the Nurse to ring him back because he couldn't get his glove off quick enough" are really unprofessional and not called for. As a family we are experiencing a difficult time. Every one in our family unit has a disability. We are still trying to work despite countless medical appointments. This is a difficult time for everyone. I'm not complaining about the wait, I appreciate that everyone is busy at this time, but if we need to bear with you, then you need to bear with your patients too. As a Practice you are dealing with people with complex lives and showing a human side helps. Generally your reception staff are personable and it does help, but today I was disappointed. What was done well was that my husband did in fact receive a callback from the nurse which was welcomed because he really wanted to discuss results from tests that were done on 31st July. He again had waited patiently for nearly three weeks for these results. We appreciate all the hard work that everyone puts in but please remember that your receptionists are the "public face" of the Practice and they need to remember their customer service skills in these situations.

title: bad service
body: I had to wait for blood test results for 47 days. Tests results were ready within 2 weeks time after given the blood in other place and it was sent to them by post. But, they said they did not receive it. Then I keep telling them to collect my test results. Every time they assured me but not collected . when at the reception I told them I will do complain about this,   then they following day they collected the results . When doctor reading my report with very rush over telephone and she found there was missing my urine test report and advised to do again . I am not sure what's going on with my report . As a full time key worker I really got upset and its like they do not care about patient, I never seen this type GP.

title: Birth Centre experience
body: I gave birth in birth Centre last week and would highly recommend it. After having terrible experience giving birth at St. Mary's hospital we decided on trying birth Centre at whittington and what a change that was! From the phone call to the arrival i felt already in much more relax environment (which helps during labour). At arrival I was taken to the room, offered covid test, examined and introduced to my midwife. I was offered water birth (unfortunately I progressed quiet quickly and there was no time). My midwife was absolute star! I couldn't wish for better one. She was exlerianced, encouraging and just what I needed at the time. Room was specious with birth pool, birth stool, ball and more. My Little girl arrived in the early mornig and we were left to bond which was so lovely. My partner was allowed to stay and we had all time for skin to skin and lots of first cuddles with our new arrival. I would highly recommend it.

author: Norma M K
title: Abstaining from alcohol
body:
I contacted my GP, at my lowest ebb. He advised me to call Inclusion. I spoke to one of the councillors, Dave. I was then sent some work books, and was called by Dave each week, he is sick at the moment, so Terry, at Havant has taken his place. It's been difficult, during lockdown. I've been attending online meetings, with Chris, at inclusion, ACT and SMART, which are all very helpful. I had a call from one of the nurse practicioners, and was prescribed Acamposate. It has all been a life saver, as it has helped me go from having a drink every single day, for 15+ years, to being an ex-drinker.
I am looking forward to face to face meetings, hopefully soon. Also, to having some acupuncture.
Thank you all

title: If you value your mental health don't go
body:
I've been with Bentley house for maybe 2 years now and in the beginning the services were good. I was able to get the help I needed to steady myself and get my medication in track. But as I experience some sevre lows, I was consistently made to feel like what I was feeling wasn't valid and but yet I was still offered medication? How does that work? A traumatic event for me then occurred at the beginning off this year. I came in for help and counselling around this issue not medication which was still offered to me and a prescription was still given to me as a 'just in case'. I feel completely failed bye the system at this point. I appreciate with covid any attempts in counselling would either be on hold or a long waiting list has accumulated. Despite this when I call for an update on my case I would still appreciate being contacted back eventually instead of having to hear it from the out of hours crisis team. I have tried self referrals to other establishments just for the counselling but none of them will even consider me because I am under Bentley house yet I am made to feel pointless and discharged all because I made the better decision for myself not go be on any medication. The receptionists are no better than the doctors, some are good and clearly care about their job and others are down right rude. At this point with how much I've tried to get help for myself which is really hard to do on your own I mainly want things to be looked at and changed for others within that service. During covid phone calls between me and the person I'm assigned two was 'arranged', I use this term loosely, this is because a time and day was set and I had no phone call and I persistently tried too get in contact to see what had gone wrong only to be contacted bye surprise at 7am only to be told she will call back later when no one ever did. I then proceeded to contact the reception and I was made to feel so stupid with the response off "well next time just take the call there are other patients". I am fully aware of other patients within the system but when an appointment is made for me, I would like that to be kept or at least just some communication if things have been missed or it needs to be moved. I can't even get help from my gp at this point because they just tell me to call bentley house again.
If you have the chance to go to a different mental health service please do

readBy.name: Central and North West London Mental Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Outstanding practice
body: This practice is truly outstanding. All staff are professional and courteous. I have never encountered any issues a prompt and caring service is always provided. The communications are fantastic. This surgery should be an example of how to provide healthcare.

title: Brilliant loved the staff on A&E and on the…
body: The Nurses, Doctors and Consultants were just brilliant I couldn't ask for anything more from the hospital at such a busy night/day

title: Excellent Service Ground Floor Ultrasound
body:
Informative letter received for appointment, courtesy call day before appointment.  On arrival masks and hand gel at entrance, clean corridors well marked for walking on the left hand side with social distancing markers.
Ultrasound department clean and well marked for social distancing.  Staff polite and very helpful.  Clinic running on time.
At the appointment the team explained everything and talked me through what they were doing, which made me comfortable and at easy.
Would like to add the team are a credit to the trust and the NHS.

readBy.name: Tameside and Glossop Integrated Care NHS Foundation Trust

title: Efficient practice
body: The practice offered an excellent and efficient service on my most recent visit. After a telephone conversation a face to face appointment was undertaken.

title: Shocking Practice
body:
The doctors and nurses are OK once you have an appointment but the reception staff are so unpleasant and unhelpful. 

Long call waiting times and limited appointments are understandable, especially during these times but not being able to get a doctors appointment (or pre-book online anymore) for 6 months is ridiculous. The system which has been set up is shocking, and the receptionists who answer the calls are so unhelpful, no checking cancelled appointments, you can no longer book in advance for non-urgent appointments. 

You would expect having telephone appointments with the doctors now would mean waiting times are reduced but the only way to have an appointment is to call on the day but this is difficult if you work out of the city and with appointments being fully booked by 9am (having been on hold for 15 minutes).

title: Great and polite phone manner
body: I visited this walk in centre yesterday after being told by 111 to visit as I needed to be seen by a nurse/doctor. Upon visiting, the walk in was closed and there was a phone number to call to speak to someone. At this point I was frustrated as I had fallen ill at 1pm and it was now 4pm, I had been on the phone to multiple clinicians and felt strongly that I needed to see someone. So when I rang the walk-in centre number as advised, I got a little upset on the phone that I was explaining my symptoms again. They lady on the other end of the phone was nothing but polite and understanding and they dealt with my problem straight away (suggesting I go to A&E). Thank you so much for being so patient and kind and understanding, again I apologise for getting upset. You have trained your staff so well and I would definitely recommend this walk-in to anyone. Especially during the current situation, they picked up the phone straight away and gave me quick advice- definitely recommend.

title: Feeling safe during Covid
body: Was a bit nervous of visiting the doctors during the pandemic but was made to feel very safe. It was a doctor I hadn't seen before and he couldn't have been more thorough and understanding and I left feeling very reassured and listened to!

title: Caring Practice
body:
I have had dealings over the last year with several Doctors in the practice.
The care,understanding and professionalism has been 2nd to none.Every doctor has had time to listen ,explanations and advice ,wonderful. In this difficult time they are doing a sterling job.
The appointment situation can be stressful but l am sure no different to any other practice.
Thank You all for your hard work and caring attitude. 
Stay safe .

title: Brilliant Practice
body: I’ve really been impressed since joining this surgery, due to the amount of doctors available, and most certainly the ease in getting an appointment through the online booking system. The staff are very friendly and helpful. I also find the telephone call back system very useful. Overall very pleased with the service I receive.

title: Complete Service
body: On Tue 11th August I experienced loss of feeling in my right leg. Within 20 minutes of calling 111, an ambulance arrived and I received initial care. I was then blue lighted to FPH. Within a couple of hours, I was scanned and admitted to F2 and operated on the following day. The care I received throughout this traumatic time was outstanding and I cannot give enough praise to the team (night and day) Their care and dedication was exemplary. Thank you, thank you, thank you NHS for saving my life. I will forever be in your debt.

title: Went the extra mile
body:
My nurse explained everything to me in what could have been a really uncomfortable appointment. She was really calm and very professional and I was so appreciative. 
Receptionists are always nice and happy to help.

title: So grateful!
body:
Having severe problem with hearing loss I contacted the hospital via email and explained my situation.   About 6 weeks ago I had requested to be transferred to Warrington hospital for ENT and because I was having great difficulty to hear, was fairly desperate for an appointment.  The Communications person answered my email immediately and as a result of that exceptional service and  help, not only was I reassured that an appointment would follow, but the next day was offered a cancellation.  
The Communications person is a star in my opinion, as also was the ENT nurse who swiftly, and compassionately sorted out my hearing loss problem.      I recommend Warrington Hospital!

title: Excellent GP service
body: On Wednesday 12 August I had a telephone appointment with my GP.  The care and attention to detail was excellent. Not only did he facilitate a Urology appointment and a back X-ray (amazingly on 11 September thanks to my Doctor’s prompt action) but also he prescribed tablets for a water condition without which could have affected my forthcoming holiday.  I couldn’t have had better and quicker service had I seen a private physician.  I have nothing but praise for the care and advice given to me by my GP at this appointment.  Excellent service.  I also spoke to another GP at the practice the same week and again received excellent service.

title: Great service
body: Wonderful experience at Spa Medica Newcastle under Lyme, the staff were very friendly, helpful and understanding, explained everything they were doing and what was going to happen with my cataract surgery, everything went perfectly well and the result was fantastic overall a great result and would certainly recommend Spa Medica

title: Awful service
body: I really think the people who are responsible for running this practice need to take a long hard look in the mirror and ask themselves if they are actually there for their patients, because I believe they aren't. We all pay for the NHS and we aren't getting value for money, it is nigh on impossible to get an appointment at this surgery. If you are ill then phoning day after day at 8am to be told there are no appointments and to ring back tomorrow at 8am is not acceptable, there is no concern for setting patients in my experience. I cannot tell you how disappointing this practice is.

title: Friendly smiles
body: Whenever I have visited i am always greeted with easy going and happy to help receptionists. I would recommend the GP practice because of their friendly interactions.

title: Unhelpful nurse
body: Good Morning ! So last night I was desperate to look for help for my mother ! Shortly after arrival we were taken to the room by the nurse and her assistant ! The nurse who spoke to us was very unhelpful very harsh and clearly was trying to push me and my mother out of the hospital ! Luckily we stayed and we were seen by the helpful doctor who cared and helped my mother ! My mum was so upset we just couldn’t believe that such a rude person can actually work as a nurse ! It’s just so unfair to be treated like that when you are desperate for help . I do hope this was just one off and the nurse won’t be treating people like that on the arrival to a&e department. Thanks

readBy.name: Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust

author: SPI
title: Quite a pleasant appointment
body: I was quite nervous about the appointment and surgery, my appointment was with a nurse called Claire.   She was brilliant! !   Friendly, so easy to talk to, took time to put me at ease, never made me feel rushed.   She really made it quite a pleasant experience.

author: Tinfoilhat
title: The staff are amazing
body: My daughter was taking in to Dr Gray's kids ward, which I didn't even know was open. I thought we were going to get put to Aberdeen. I'm glad Dr Gray's was able to care for my daughter and we didn't have extra travelling. I have 3 other children at home 1 with a major disability. Its easier for us to attend Dr Gray's hospital as its our area and I'm not to far from family for support. Im glad Dr Gray's kids ward is open and I hope it can remains open in the future. The staff are amazing here.

author: Covid1sttimemum
title: Amazing support and care provided
body: Amazing support and care provided by all staff during the complex and lengthy delivery of my baby boy.   Special thanks to staff in Labour ward, Neonatal ICU, and Ashgrove Ward.

author: Paul R
title: My surgery and after care
body:
51 year old man, not exactly fit but not overly unfit either. I was diagnosed with complete heart block 2 years ago and had a pacemaker implant in August 2018.  
Subsequent problems resulted in me having an angiogram which determined I required a triple heart bypass and a mechanical mitrial valve replacement. I can hear it ticking away inside me now. Tick tick tick. It's not unpleasant.  
I received my appointment for surgery fairly quickly especially during these days of Pandemic lockdown. I was admitted to Hospital in August 2020, operated on the following day and was discharged 5 days later. Those figures, on their own, are fairly impressive. But it only serves as a very small piece of the story.  
From the surgeon to the catering staff, everyone I encountered was pleasant, engaging and, most importantly, thoroughly professional. Make no mistake, these guys are the BEST. I love them all. They made my stay so much easier to get through. The nursing staff could not do enough. I think they are brilliant. Every one of them.  
I was given virtual meeting appointments with the surgeon and the anaesthetist. Both of whom explained everything that would happen clearly and allowed me to ask any questions I had. And I did have a few. I would say that the one worry I did have about the operation was waking up with a breathing tube in my mouth. That kinda freaked me out. The anaesthetist made it clear to me that it wasn't worth focusing on because a) I probably wouldn't remember it and b) Even if I did I'd be too out my face on drugs to care. She was right, it was b)  
So from beginning to end I would say I felt thoroughly engaged and treated very well indeed.  
When some people see reviews like that, their expectation levels are such that patients at the Golden Jubilee or any NHS hospital are pampered like in a 7* Hotel. This is not the case. The patient must take responsibility for their own health. And that includes wiping their own arse. NHS staff should be treated with the utmost respect as they are trying to fix you, not pamper you.  
My parting shot is that I did not approve of the sky clapping for the NHS introduced by simpering MPs who put the squeeze on public funding but are quite happy to give themselves a nice 10% payrise when it suits them. The NHS is clearly underfunded and evidently understaffed as a result. Sometimes I did have to wait for something to happen a little longer than I would normally like. Deal with it. These people are running about with very little break time. I would like to say thank you NHS. More importantly however I think I would rather say (to our shambles of a Govt) give these guys the money and resources that they need. They deserve it, I can vouch for that.

author: Nicgm86
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Pulmonary Rehab, virtual, Rushcliffe services
body: Thought the online course was very good, was due to go to classes but due to COVID19 this was stopped. Found the 6 week programme helpful, look after very well, constant contract, 2 home visits, found the literature aspect was fine, leant a lot about COPD, video exercises were excellent. Stated good support, felt he was important to then staff and they knew what was happening, nothing but praise

author: Nicgm86
authorRole: a staff member posting for a patient/service user
title: Respiratory Nurses- Rushcliffe
body:
Useful service  
supportive  
informative  
helped talking/ having contact- improved knowledge by having specialist input

author: gredal
title: hairline fracture in pelvis
body:
Friday my daughter phoned for an ambulance after my fall the evening before. Not being an emergency we were updated every half hour and finally by 10 the ambulance came. In A&E everyone greeted me with a smile and their first name and had the decency at no time to ask me who the prime minister was (I am 87). At one o'clock I was even offered a cup of tea and a sandwich. By 2 o.clock my Daughter picked me up again.  
In spite of pain, inconvenience etc the NHS turned it into a wonderful experience. Thanks to all!

author: Benji2015
title: Biopsy
body:
I went for a appointment In Stirling community hospital dermatology and seeing as the biopsy team were in they said it would be good to get it done there and then to save coming back.  
I am terrified of needles so straight away I became anxious and scared the dr reassured me that the doctor doing the biopsy would be great and make me feel at ease.  
When it came to having the biopsy I was terrified and made David and his assistant aware and they made sure they did their best to made me feel at ease. They talked to me and tried to take my mind of it.  
After wards when I felt dizzy they knew straight away what to do to help me and made Me feel Safe.  
So couldn’t fault my experience

author: Jotarider
title: Getting help to seek a new employer
body: I was not working following an accident at work, the team at working win helped me to compose a new CV & gave me the motivation to seek out a solution to my dismissal with my employer. The  team also gave me the support I needed to register with several employment agencies & to send my CV to possible new employers. At first I was sceptical but gradually my self confidence grew & my anger at being off work through an accident diminished. Now I feel confident enough in myself to apply for jobs I see advertised in the local press.

author: chamaeleonkr49
title: Exemplary care
body:
My partner has had to be sent to the Ambulatory Care Unit by the GP twice since discharge from rehab following ICH.  
Both occasions have been exemplary. All staff are efficient, kind and thorough, and the Unit is spotlessly clean. You certainly feel that you are in safe competent hands.

readBy.name: The Newcastle upon Tyne Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

author: Farfelue
title: They all deserve great credit
body: I was admitted to Ninewells after a complex ankle fracture. On admission I was immediately struck by the efficiency and kindness of the staff. The immediate procedures were explained to me and appropriate pain relief ensured. After surgery I spent time both on Ward 9 and Ward 18. In both busy wards, staff were unfailingly kind, efficient and professional. We were treated with respect, patience and real humanity. They all deserve great credit.

author: Two stars and a wish
title: Bike accident!
body:
My daughter attended today following a bike accident yesterday.  
She went to the A&E reception where I dropped her, and got a fairly brusque reception that she needed to go to OPD6 instead (Minor Injuries).  
In MIU, she says the two receptionists were lovely! The Nurse Practitioner was professional and thorough, as well as being very nice, and kind. No Xrays required as she’s been good with her safety. She was given advice to return if no better next week.  
Sadly, she didn’t catch her name, so can’t say a personal thank you here.  
Our main criticism is that despite being stopped outside A&E by a man giving directions and checking our reason for being there, he didn’t mention that MIU was in a separate place and perhaps we should’ve gone there instead. As a result, my daughter had a very long “hop” round the back of the building to get to the right place! If we’d been given the option of MIU, we’d have gone there directly first.

author: Lexham
title: A near me Appointment with Physio
body: To date I have had a very good experience with the Physio, today though I was waiting for my near-me appointment for 25 min with no explanation as to why I was not being seen, after ringing which meant I was waiting a further 7 min to get through I was told some story which I was not convinced by the end result is I was unable to have my appointment, I was told the physio manage the caseload and are unable to come out of a session if this is the case then the system is not working and is failing patients this no means I will be waiting 6 weeks from my last appointment, I feel distressed and angry at this lack of respect for patients, we get text telling us about missed appointments what happens when its the other way around a wasted morning. Poor managemet of clients and poor communication does anyone care I doubt it so here we are.

author: Minisue
title: A visit to local A&E department
body:
I went to my local department after experiencing a bang to the head. The reception staff were working hard to manage social distancing and communication with patients through masks and screens. The only problem with this is that patients have to announce loudly why they are there which impacts on confidentiality and privacy.  
The waiting area was safely arranged for distancing. I was seen quickly, maybe triaged as a priority due to my injury. The waiting area was busy, so I had anticipated a long wait. I was seen by a Dr and assessed. She was patient, understanding and explained the symptoms of concussion really well to me. Apologetic for any delays (which weren't that bad! ), gave me relevant information and pain relief. Reassured me and informed me on steps to take should things have worsened. It was quick, efficient, person centred and very much appreciated.

author: Bremmy
title: Would love to know when surgeries are starting again
body: Have now been waiting for a hip replacement for 1 year and am now almost at my wit's end. Am in constant pain and discomfort. Have constantly phoned Dr Gray's to get updates but am being told that the government hasn't given the go ahead. I understand the situation with covid 19 but surely with proper short term isolation and testing these operations should be going ahead. I'm a relatively young man and my work responsibilities are being affected drastically now. (Sick pay running out). Please would love to know when they are starting again.

author: thankfulGill
title: Excellent care in the emergency department
body:
I attended the emergency department with my nanny who had fallen and injured her wrist.  
My Nanny Is 84 years old and had been shielding for the past 4 months. This was the first time she had actually left the house and was causing her a lot of anxiety.  
From the moment we arrived in ED the staff were incredible. Sister Boal explained the reason behind wearing face coverings and reduced all anxiety with a clear plan. We were seen by Dr McCorkell who examined the wrist, organised an x-ray, and reviewed this x-ray concluding that the right wrist was fractured.  
Sister Boal applied a plaster of Paris and we were home before we knew it. We could not be more thankful to all the staff in the emergency department.

readBy.name: South Eastern Health and Social Care Trust

author: Anon2020
title: Excellent Physiotherapist
body:
I’m writing to express my thanks to Kenny, an amazing Physiotherapist in NHS Lanarkshire.  
For over a year and a half I have been struggling with chronic pain which has really affected my life dramatically. Throughout that time I have sought help from medical professionals and often felt like my issues were not explored thoroughly enough. It seemed to me that I was being treated like a nuisance for constantly returning with the same issue and was just given a different medication or increased dosage then sent away with no real plan of action to resolve the issue.  
Kenny was great at explaining things in a way that was easy for me to understand. It was clear that he really knew what he was talking about and was very knowledgeable. He even went to the effort of printing off a booklet I could take home to further my understanding of my issues. I got a sense that Kenny really did care about the issues I was having and genuinely wanted to help me. Although Kenny’s specialist area of Physiotherapy can’t resolve my issue, Kenny has referred me on to the best person who can help. Even after the appointment he gave me a call just to confirm that he had spoken to the specialist I have been referred to. I was really touched by how much he cared and this gave me real confidence I am on the right track to better health.  
I can’t thank Kenny enough for this invaluable advice and how this has helped me to move forward with getting better.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Rms1
title: My experience
body: I had cut my leg accidentally on a broken plate, the moment I arrived my family weren’t allowed in with me, I suffer from major depression and high anxiety and to top it off wearing a mask really heightens my nervousness. I understand with the current situation going on that family aren’t allowed in but I wasn’t helped or made to feel at easy by any of the staff. I felt that because of my previous self harm scars the doctor and nurse assumed I had done it on purpose. They didn’t really ask me outright if it was done on purpose but made some comment about how it’s funny the cuts gone that way when if It was an accident it would of gone this way, It felt to me like they didn’t like me and that I was wasting their time. I felt judged and It was like they couldn’t get rid of me fast enough and not because they wanted it to be done quickly for me but because they simply didn’t want me there. I tried to make conversation with one nurse who glued and dressed my cut to try and make myself feel more at ease, but it felt like she really didn’t care in the slightest about anything I said and I just felt like a nuisance. The only good thing about the whole experience was That I was in and out in an hour. I just feel a little more care and help would of made me feel so better and at ease

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

title: Improvements
body:
Have seen some vast improvements over the last couple of months, more staff, more appointments available and prescriptions getting done in record time.   It has been a rocky year which is to be expected I think what with NHS funding, the merge on top and the staff under pressure they done amazingly well under the circumstances.  

Me and my family have struggled at times to get appointments, struggled to get out prescriptions on time in the past but have always been treated with dignity and kindness and that is what stopped is going elsewhere.  From what I hear a lot of surgeries are struggling but this one seems to be on the right track to getting things sorted.

author: sussy
title: Lack of care plan. No care in the community
body:
Met doctor in February 2020.  
My CPN left her job.  
I was trying to get support to help me with online prescriptions repeats. Unfortunately I still haven't had no care in the community which I am entitled to.  
My phone calls over 3 months have been ignored I had 1 phone call telling me no one was around and another email will be sent.  
I have acute paranoid symptoms which are getting worse I think they are doing it on purpose and want me to die.  
They know I am alone without any relatives family or friends that can help when I am un well.  
It's getting beyond a joke and my care at the moment is clozapine clinic at ystrad mynach every four weeks with a blood nurse may I add very unfamiliar faces. I asked for help and the nurse said she is not I.T literiture and of old skool material and couldn't help. She dismissed me and gave my closapine and sent me out next one in.  
It's getting to the point now I am looking at funeral plans and organising my LPA (legal power of attony).  
I am entitled to this care and advice but because I ain't dead or carving my pain upon my own body I ain't going to get help to prevent my schizophrenia affecting me in the community.  
What is a patient in this cliche suppose to do

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2022)
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

links.id: the isolation is affecting my mental well being

author: Gummi2019
title: Good spirits and Love of the job
body:
I was rushed into ward 23b at Ninewells Hospital as I had fractured my skull and part of my back which meant I had to lie horizontal for 4 days.  
All of the staff were amazing but the nurses during my stay were outstanding. No request was too big or too small, they treated you like a patient and a friend. They kept my spirits high ans made sure I was comfortable at all times. Had I not had this experience I doubt my time here would have gone as quickly as it did. Thanks you, I will never forget what you have done for me and how you have made me feel! ! ! Angels indeed! Xxxxx

title: 1st class service
body: Had to attend A & E on 8/8/2020 with chronic cervical pain and other symptoms.  Staff from entering all extremely good.  A & E Dr saw me and organised a CT scan due to previous major spinal surgery and decided to call  someone from the Spinal Dept.  I was seen by a Registrar who was excellent.  Urgent MRI scans ordered as an outpatient and then a follow up appointment with Consultant Spinal Surgeon.  I simply cannot fault the reception, the nurses the Dr the CT scan dept the Registrar.  Thank you so very much to you all and thank you NHS.  All practices in place to help prevent COVID19.

readBy.name: East Suffolk and North Essex NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice
body: Always responsive and helpful. In 2014 they saved my life - within 30 minutes of being seen I was on my way to hospital. Thank you!

title: 53 hours later
body:
Arrived at A and E at 2pm, I had my 3 week old and 11 year old daughters with me as I had no other option.

Was told I would be sent through the out of hours GP so had to go back to the car to be triaged and wait for the dr to ring me (no problem there due to corona)

Dr rang me an hour later informing me as I'm breastfeeding I would have to go through a and e due to different medications. Fair enough.

Was sent to sit in the wrong area so had staff looking for me, got to SDEC about 4 oclock, had stats and blood taken at 4.30pm. Then didn't see a DR till 9.45pm. I still had my daughters with me. 
I got told the test was positive so I was highly likely to have a blood clot in my leg.
Got sent home with a blood thinner and told to come back at 11am next day for a scan but one of the nurses told me to ring first due to me having to bring baby aswell. I rang up next morning to be told that the AAU isn't operational today and I would have to ring ultrasound myself to book a scan. Rang and left a message to have a call an hour later to say we can't scan you today it will have to be tomorrow. Fair enough I can appreciate how busy it is but I have a high risk of a blood clot and I havent had anyone else ring me about more blood thinners. I ended up ringing a and e myself to ask what to do. I had to go over at 8pm that night for an injection ( I live 45 mins away) The next day I had my scan and a blood clot was found in my thigh,12pm so 46 hours after first stepping into a and e I have finally had confirmation of a clot.
Got sent to AAU, was ready to leave at 3.30pm once the pharmacy had brought my medication up. Had to wait till 7pm for a senior dr to discharge me. Also had my children with me so another 8 and a half hours in hospital when it should of been a lot less.
What is the most concerning thing for me is that I would of been left with no option of another blood thinner on the day inbetween a and e vist and the scan and I have a blood clot if I hadn't of chased it up myself.

I have no complaints whatsoever over the staff, you can see how stretched the nurses are, chasing drs for their patients and then being snapped at and spoken to like rubbish by some of the senior drs.

What I am complaining about is it taking 53 hours for me to be fully diagnosed with a blood clot when it is such a dangerous condition.

title: Horrible
body: I have visited Maidstone hospital with my partner ( 6 months pregnant ) as we have been reffered by our GP . Service once arrived was good and they have adviced that they will be someone calling us to make anither appointment which did not happen. I have been trying to call for a week to make this appointment as it is very important for my partner but they have neen hanging up the phone and i dont know what to do

title: Poor Overall After Care
body: 1.1st day back on ward wrong name on board                                             2.Blood test lost in system,no one checked if at arrived at Lab,4 hours wasted even though system was known to be  faulty.                                     3.Cleaning bathroom/room only clean once.                                            4.Food not edible and tea stewed.

title: Blood Test dept appointment
body: I have tried phoning the blood test deparment today at least 7 times for an esstential blood test appointment. Each time I get cut off. They are irresponsible.

title: Excellent practice
body:
I made a telephone appointment- all fine.
GP rang me then I went in to see him.
I had another telephone appointment in July. 
My GP was knowledgeable, kind and understanding.
The whole experience left me feeling respected and grateful for my excellent GP and the practice. Thank you .

title: Centre for excellence
body: Kind, caring, reassuring. Expert medical care. All my treatment from pre op right through surgery was really wonderful. All hygiene precautions were in place to cope with the covid 19. The team throughout were very informative as to the procedure. I have to have an operation for a cateract on my left eye but after my previous experience and an amazingly successful result I know that my procedure will be in excellent hands. Thank you to all the team. Derek Fogg

title: hopeless
body:
referred by my excellent Dr at Tetford 6 months ago for a carpal tunnel procedure. i realise there is a Pandemic at moment but people at least could be informed with a standard letter.
not impressed. I feel sorry for people with serious medical problems.

title: Very good doctors
body:
Big shout out to this practice 
Very good understanding of Autism with regards to my daughter and nothing seems to be any trouble for them

title: Overall an awful GP
body: I can't begin to count the issues I've had with this GP. Anything from no appointments for 4 weeks, felt being rushed when having an appointment, bookings not being made correctly. I've only seen one Doctor there who actually seemed as if she cared and was compassionate for patients. I've had friends and family members leave the practice and move elsewhere within the last 2 years due to their own experiences. I now live abroad and have been asked to provide part of my medical history to my GP in Australia and to try and get an email or contact for this practice was like trying to crack the DaVinci Code. 99% of practices have their email accessible, not here though. At first trying to get an contactable email address was like pulling teeth, they didn't want to give one. Then when told about the seriousness got one, gave the WRONG email out. Then when called again was spoken to on the phone as if it was an awful thing to ask for an email and that "We're not allowed to give it out". I'm glad I don't have to deal with Middleton Lodge anymore and I would recommend to anyone to sign up to another local GP. The Practice Manager should be ashamed of the way that place is run and it's staff.

title: Great place
body:
Friendly communication via phone to book appt. text service reminder really helpful too. 
Friendly staff on arrival and clear signs for covid safety. 
Kind and friendly staff.

title: Brilliant ward B3
body:
I stayed on ward B3 for 5 days with a bad back and I would just like to say a big thanks to all the staff.
The care I received was absolutely fantastic and I would like to say a big thanks to all the staff on B3 and a big thanks to the 2 paramedics that brought me in thank you 😊

readBy.name: St Helens and Knowsley Hospitals NHS Trust

title: Brilliant GP practice
body: Always easy to get an appointment when you need one despite only being a small surgery. I’ve had brilliant support with my baby, quick referrals and resolutions and they have been incredible during the Covid period. Very thankful to have them as our GP

title: Grateful Thanks
body:
I was in hospital on and off from 6th August to 10th August, 2020 utilising the services of A and E, Surgical Assessment Unit, Blake Ward, and Gould Ward in dealing with my trauma of falling from a step ladder and sustaining rib damage and a pneumothorax in my right lung.
I experienced nothing but sympathetic treatment in all departments I was placed in and especially remember the caring and gentle nature of the night staff in Gould Ward where members of staff Sherwin and his colleague were particularly understanding. I was also impressed by the way the staff in A and E dealt with a very abusive member of the public - you should not have to deal with such cases. Thank you for your care.

title: Bad communication
body: My poor mother has been at this surgery over 35 yr and they still get her prescription wrong every friday!? All she asks is not to be chasing round for medication every week!

title: Aweful waste of time
body: Generally the interactions are rude,  condescending and overly patronising. They are not proving any care it seems, just phone calls!! So I want to be clear here. I have excruciating relentless pain. The pain relief I was on was causing other serious side effects, side effects they wer enot aware were possible. There solution to this is to immediately stop this pain med and offer up absolulty no suitable alternative. So effectively I have gone from opiods to paracetamol. Paracetamol does nothing, nothing. My pain needs treatment, this place seemingly are unable to offer an appointment for injections, they can't even offer an idea of when an appointment might be. A month, 2months, 3 months? They don't know and frankly don't care. Instead, they want to have monthly phone conversations to deliver "care". Right. My condition is a phycial thing, do you get that? Physcial. On what planet does having a chat on the phone make any difference the pain I'm experiencing? The only difference is they obviously get paid to have completely useless phone conversations, so for the them the more the better, the fact they are a complete waste of time and provide no tangible outcome is totally irrelevant. And further to this, they try to encourage you to a group discussion setting, which they profit from again, another waste of time where you can all talk about your pain with other people in pain and solve absolulty nothing. Clearly the insinuation is that patients are lieing about their pain, and they think by talking about it all these liers will come to realise that all that pain which has destroyed their life, career and means you can't get out of bed was in fact all in your head. Condescending, patronising and frankly a completely useless service set up solely for this private company to make a buck without actually doing anything constrictive to reduce suffering in patients.

title: Closed For Lunch!
body:
Its 12:08 and Ive just phoned the practice to enquire where they have sent my repeat prescription. Theyre closed. Not the Chemist, the surgery. The answerphone message says theyre closed till 2:00pm! 
Closed for lunch ? This is like the 1960s. We'd be better off with James Herriott.

title: Extremely Poor Management
body:
Having made several attempts to contact the general enquiries by telephone and selecting option 4 as directed. On each occasion the call was ended by being cut off when I finally did get through I found nothing other than excuses around COVID -19 and extremely unhelpful staff.

Whilst I appreciate COVID -19 is causing many problems throughout the NHS blaming faulty telephone direction upon it just doesn't cut it, the staff should remain helpful and courteous at all times.

title: Online service
body: Not so much a visit due to current issues but more an online experience.  I'd just like to say thank you..   once I'd figured how to navigate your web site and upload pictures of very annoying insect bites I was telephoned back within stated time period, diagnosed by a friendly gp and agreed uplift of my prescription from a local chemist.  All in all it worked for me.. and suffice to say treatment cured my problem...   I would highly recommend

title: efficient, friendly and professional practice
body:
My husband and I are lucky to have a 'dedicated' GP who is always
responsive and helpful. Whether visiting (pre-covid19) or phoning for a consultation we have always had good and helpful advice, for which we are grateful.

title: Well.... you decide
body:
more chance of winning the lottery, than getting these to answer the phone, what's going on here is anyone's guess

used to be brilliant

title: Amazing Service
body: Very pleased with the service received from this GP Surgery. Would recommend to all! Very helpful information received from all of my Doctors and other staff at the surgery.

title: A broken service?
body: I believe this practice is flawed as you  cannot get an appointment without jumping through the many obstacles put in front of you. In light of this you book a telephone conversation, and the health provider sends you to a hospital for tests/xrays. After a week you ring to ask for the results you are told that the letter from the consultant has not been received or that the doctor hasn't looked at them yet but you can have a telephone appointment in two weeks time to discuss the results further. This is not a service! It is an ordeal

title: Not hearing loss friendly
body: I have severe hearing loss... telephones are difficult in the extreme (facemasks too) as I am a lip reader. Receptionist very patient but verbal communication painstakingly repetitive and stressful. Econsult no good as I waited by my phone until after 1pm (6.30pm deadline) uncertain whether they had received my request - they evidently don't reply personally.

title: Confusing Catchment
body: My mother (73 years old) searched on the NHS website for the nearest surgery to register at after moving house and this surgery came up as the nearest (0.8mile). But she isn't allowed to register there as apparently because the house is 'over the hill', she has to register with another surgery. Why when it's the nearest surgery? Why was it suggested on the NHS website, after entering her post code if she wasn't allowed to register there?

title: Fantastic customer service
body: Several times in the last few weeks I have needed to request phone consultations on behalf of my elderly parents. The receptionist has listened, cared and actioned without question. The GP has spoken with myself and again listened cared and actioned. In comparison with the Danbury Medical Centre, Whitley House are absolutely exceptional in their patient / customer interaction - from reception to the GP - fantastic. They should be applauded for exceeding expectations. Massive thank you.

title: Very professional and thorough
body: I attended following a motorbike accident in which it turned out I'd smashed up my upper arm. Really attentive and caring nursing, admin, radiography and medical staff saw me in and out in a couple of hours with a collar and cuff, and some anti-inflammatory tablets. Thank you one and all.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Coventry and Warwickshire NHS Trust

title: Amazing, sensitive, caring staff
body: My daughter and her partner had twin babies on Monday and sadly one was stillborn. The care, attention, love, understanding and empathy given to my daugher and her partner were outstanding and made a big difference to them at a very sad time. Thank you from the bottom of my heart

readBy.name: East Kent Hospitals University NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great practice from entry to exit
body: This surgery goes above and beyond to ensure the patient experience, however minor or major, is kind, caring, understanding and knowledgeable. The fantastic ladies on reception have never failed to smile, show empathy and will go out of their way to help where they can; never once have I felt their questions to be intrusive and they are happy to explain the process from start to finish. The nurses and ANP have a huge skill set and played a crucial role in obtaining a diagnosis for my mother to enable the unique kind of care she needed to ensure her last months were ones of dignity and love. I have the greatest admiration for the nurse who takes my blood every month as I’m not the easiest person when I comes to needles, but she remembers this and goes a long way to relax me if I’m particularly bad. So, finally the doctors, and I’ve seen a few at this surgery but without their knowledge, input, guidance and advice they have given me over the last few months, I can say with some confidence that my outcomes would be considerably less positive than they currently are., and for that I give my gratitude to the whole surgery.

title: Waiting too long on the phone
body: Message today to book a flu jab,rang and after 60 minutes 40 of which I was number one in the queue I finally gave it up as a bad job. It was in the afternoon as you ask us to do!

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2021)

title: Excellent Staff
body: I have found this surgery the best place, with a very helpful and friendly staff. They have been very supportive to me and my family during our very hard times. I always feel at home whenever I visit the place. They are like family to me. I registered here in 2011 since my admission at Sussex University, and I cannot think of any other surgery though I have left the University more than two years ago. Wish them best of luck.

title: Very Professional
body:
This GP Practice provides a friendly, caring, competent medical facility.
It always appears to me to be an efficient, well organised and very professional Practice, with appointments offered at 3 local Surgeries.
The Doctors and staff are of course always busy, but always seem willing to help. They are knowledgeable, they listen and they explain all the relevant issues.
It is a Practice which provides pro-active advice and support, in a friendly, compassionate way. 
The whole team - Doctors, Nurses, Pharmacists, Receptionists - all seem keen to provide a helpful and effective service. It’s reassuring to know they’re there to help, if and when the need arises......
Many Thanks.

title: Never seen on time!
body: Today was the third occasion in as many months where my appointment was running late. This time by over an hour! I had to arrange childcare for the appointment due to Covid rules and this delay caused my childcare provider massive issues. It is always the same and I can only presume that they must massively overbook appointments. So frustrating when they are so rude if you are ever more than 5 mins late!

title: Excellent Practise
body: The doctor was caring, thorough and dealt with my concerns with respect. Also, many thanks to the operations manager who dealt with a query quickly and professionally.

title: Excellent and Dedicated Team
body:
Thank you to the Rheumatology Daycare Team for once again providing an excellent service particularly during the Covid 19 pandemic. 

This team is a very dedicated, professional and friendly team. 
The team has provided an excellent service throughout the pandemic and maintains strict Covid 19 hygiene procedures. The team are extremely efficient, they know what they are doing working in a very specialist area of medicine. The treatment which they deliver makes a huge impact on people’s lives. The team reassures patients, ensures that the patient gets the very important care they need and the unit is run with great efficiency. The team have a really great way of communicating with patients and a lovely friendly manner. It makes a huge difference when medical professionals have a cheerful manner and this team always makes the patient feel welcome. The team is a great credit to Northwick Park Hospital and the NHS. Thank you so much 😊

readBy.name: London North West University Healthcare NHS Trust

title: Good care
body:
My two and half year old daughter came for an sedation mri scan and the care I received from the senior staff nurse was amazing his bed side manner was great and he monitored and reassured me throughout 
Credit where credits due especially during these diffcult times 
Thank you

title: Poor Management
body: Some of the receptionist are very rude. You hardly get an appointment. When you call them the answering machine asks you to choose certain button to make appointment. After that it will let you to a queue and finally waiting almost an hour someone talks to you in a rough voice to tell you - call tomorrow morning to make an appointment. The system also tells you, we can make appointments on line. When you actually attempt to do so, it says, your details are not recognised in the practice. Horrible!

title: Great practice
body: All staff are very helpful doctors and receptionists they are very polite and respond swiftly I highly rate this practice

title: Not good
body: Reception staff helpful . Very hard to speak or see a gp when requesting a certificate had goe through 3 times and it is still not right .

title: First class treatment
body: I have had to visit the Urgent Care Centre twice recently. First time for a badly cut hand and second time sent by my GP. On both occasions the care and attention I was given could not have been better. Totally professional but in a friendly and caring way keeping me relaxed at a quite stressful time.

readBy.name: Lancashire Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust
